column4:
#COVID-19 has cost us hundreds of thousands of lives, millions of jobs, & affected nearly every corner of the earth.
 
We must take every step possible to #PreventFuturePandemics which is why I’m joining my colleagues to stop these diseases at the source. https://t.co/W3IdREmV7F

Facebook has a duty to ensure it does not become a vector for disinformation.
 
In the days leading up to the election, @GKButterfield, @RepAdams & I are asking Facebook to immediately confront these troubling reports and take action to protect the health of our democracy. https://t.co/SzimNlvzxG

New COVID-19 cases are at the highest point yet. We can’t count on the White House to do the right thing, but each of us can take action to slow the spread. 

Follow the three W’s – Wear a mask, Wash your hands, and Wait 6 feet apart.

https://t.co/dbKpCWXP5S

(1/5) Domestic violence harms millions nationwide – and the impacts have worsened during the #COVID19 pandemic.

During #DomesticViolenceAwarenessMonth, I'm sharing local resources for where individuals can turn for help:

Today, @realdonaldtrump’s @FCC doubled down on its decision to gut #NetNeutrality, jeopardizing public safety & broadband access.

As #COVID19 has shifted schools & work online, we need MORE internet access, not less. I’ll fight this decision until #NetNeutrality is restored. https://t.co/dHAJ9KXFAC

In the US: 8.5+ million #COVID19 cases, 225k+ deaths, and 23+ million unemployed.

Instead of providing relief, the GOP Senate & White House are actively ramming through a SCOTUS nominee today.

It’s clear that consolidating power is more important to them than saving lives.

Too many essential workers are being put in harm’s way because the Trump admin refuses to implement simple, effective protection strategies.

We have to face the facts: we need a mask requirement on public transit for workers and riders immediately. https://t.co/BxRGOHII7j

The American people are tired of Trump continuing to reject science in his disastrous COVID response.

They're tired of the GOP refusing to provide meaningful COVID-19 relief.

They're tired of trailing behind other nations in our public health response & recovery. https://t.co/3RWcyVcZyJ

In his short time at the university, he led with purpose and used a science-based approach to assist students and faculty in navigating the challenges of beginning an academic year during the COVID-19 pandemic.

While we continue to battle #COVID19, don't forget that flu season is here. Protect yourself and your neighbors by getting a flu shot. Find one near you: https://t.co/NJXVXSCa7K https://t.co/zYaDTLbtV5

Millions of families could be evicted because the Republican Senate won't pass a robust #COVID19 relief package, even when @realdonaldtrump says “go big or go home”. @HouseDemocrats have compromised & passed bills to provide billions in rental assistance.

https://t.co/WtGVCgOKvv

An accurate census count is necessary for justly allocating federal funds, determining legislative & Electoral College representation, and so much more. The pandemic is complicating how this data is collected, processed, & verified -- leaving many in our communities uncounted. https://t.co/JQZiPTTDCu

As the Senate Judiciary Committee hearing is broadcast today, remember this:

Republicans are choosing to ram through a nominee that will undermine the ACA instead of listening to the American people and negotiating a meaningful, bipartisan COVID-19 relief package.

TODAY: I'm bringing together local experts to discuss available housing resources during the COVID-19 pandemic at my virtual town hall at 2:00 pm.
 
RSVP to join: https://t.co/daEfG4KVjJ

If we don't tackle the pending eviction crisis, we could face a homelessness crisis.

I'm bringing together local experts to discuss available housing resources during COVID-19 at my virtual town hall next Wed. Oct. 14 at 2:00 pm.

RSVP to join: https://t.co/daEfG4KVjJ

Our country is stronger when we protect & embrace all identities. I’m honored to receive a perfect score from @HRC in their Congressional Scorecard and will continue championing LGBTQI+ rights in housing, health care, education, & beyond. #HRCscorecard
https://t.co/02wUJW0WVW
The President is ranting and raving on Twitter instead of working to get a COVID relief deal. He's leaving the American people out to dry. https://t.co/cnsM9cuPRy

Despite what our President tweets, COVID-19 remains dangerous and is continuing to spread across our nation. 

Please remember to take precautions, practice the 3 W's (wait 6 feet apart, wear a mask, and wash your hands), and listen to our public health officials. #stopthespread
Glad to hear @SenThomTillis is feeling well after he tested positive for COVID-19.  I am wishing him a quick recovery.
I wish the President and First Lady well, and hope for a speedy recovery from COVID-19.

PASSED: Heroes 2.0 provides funding to help families put food on the table, protect struggling small businesses, and combat #COVID19. It also represents a commitment to sensible compromise. The ball is now in Senate's and WH's court: their time to "pause" has long expired.

We know that #COVID19 doesn't affect everyone equally: structural inequalities make some populations more susceptible. I'm proud that $80M is coming to NC-04 to coordinate a national program to help overcome health disparities and barriers to testing among underserved groups. https://t.co/UZOyMJuYlF

.@realdonaldTrump's lies are fueling the worst public health and economic crisis in this century, with 207,000+ dead and nearly 7 million infected in the U.S. His words have real world impacts. https://t.co/1tIX7mppHu

Time is running out to complete the #2020census! Census data is critical to ensuring our communities receive adequate funds for health care, transportation, schools, affordable housing, & higher education our families need to succeed.

Complete yours at https://t.co/rmKW7YnsSC.

We can't take our eye off the ball -- Senate Republicans are trying to ram through a Supreme Court justice to strike down the Affordable Care Act.

It would result in millions losing access to health care during a pandemic. We must continue to speak out—and vote.

Instead of racing to combat COVID-19, Trump’s rushing to nominate Amy Coney Barrett to the Supreme Court. She’ll repeal the Affordable Care Act, during a pandemic, and strip health care from millions of Americans.

Let the American people decide — they’re already voting.

Our public lands are a source of beauty, recreation, & environmental resiliency. 

We’re seeing the disastrous impacts of climate change right now. Preserving our country’s parks & natural places remains crucial  for our nation’s health & future prosperity. https://t.co/7YH8fsSrJq

The Affordable Care Act protects people with preexisting conditions, allows young adults to stay on parent’s health insurance, ends annual & lifetime coverage caps, and so much more.

These protections for every American could go away under a Trump SCOTUS pick. #ProtectOurCare https://t.co/nfvSJhKyBM

COVID forced businesses to quickly adapt, and too many are still struggling. 

Small biz drives our economy.  You can do your part to help small businesses bounce back and #shopsmall during #NationalSmallBusinessWeek.

To beat #COVID19, we need to follow the science. The American people deserve an administration that makes sound public health recommendations based on evidence, not political optics. Trump can’t wish away this virus. https://t.co/Z1xlKh1SNI

200,000+ COVID-19 deaths and nearly 7 million cases in the U.S., including children. It’s a lie to say the virus affects ‘virtually nobody’ below the age of 18. 

Let’s do more to keep everyone safe – wear a mask, keep socially distanced, wash your hands. https://t.co/8Crm1kb3eJ

Download SlowCOV…

Learn more: https://t.co/nEvnvTvZLk

As global conflict increases and the pandemic rages, we must continuously recommit ourselves to advocating for the dignity of all people that is essential for true and lasting peace among nations. #PeaceDay

Over 200k dead. Millions unemployed. #COVID19 continues to threaten us all. 

What is the GOP doing? Instead of hustling to pass COVID relief, Republicans plan to ram through a Supreme Court pick during an election.

GOP priorities are clear: fighting for power, not people.

On the bench, Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg led with brilliance, integrity, and fortitude. As an exemplary public servant who looked out for the long-term health of the American people and our democracy, she leaves enormous shoes that won’t easily be filled. My full statement: https://t.co/7Dsm8BZbaH

#2020Census data is critical to helping our communities thrive. It informs how the federal gov allocates $ for the health care, transportation, education, & affordable housing North Carolinians need to succeed. Complete yours today at https://t.co/rmKW7YF3Ka #BeCounted

It’s time to have an open conversation about mental health and substance abuse.

September is #RecoveryMonth. Community members struggling with addiction & mental health issues can call the SAMHSA National Helpline, 1-800-662-HELP (4357) or visit https://t.co/24wjC2Je7Y.

Small businesses are the lifeblood of our local economy, but many are closing their doors for good due to the COVID-19 pandemic. 

123 days ago, @HouseDemocrats passed the #HeroesAct to award $10bil in emergency relief. 

Relief is needed now. @senatemajldr stop blocking aid!

Senate Republicans and the White House hit “pause” on #COVID19 relief 116 days ago—costing lives and livelihoods. @HouseDemocrats passed the #HeroesAct to utilize the full resources of the federal government to defeat this virus. 

https://t.co/XiZPIYse8Y

Donald Trump knew COVID-19 was dangerous, airborne, and a threat to America. 

He knew, but he chose to downplay it. He chose to lie and he chose to let Americans die. This man is unfit to serve as our President.

Millions of Americans are facing food insecurity due to #COVID19.

AmeriCorps has the infrastructure in place to help combat the hunger crisis & the #CORPSAct will provide funding to increase resource and staff capacity & rapidly serve communities nationwide.

Across the country, local governments are struggling to meet the challenges that COVID-19 poses to our communities and schooling is no different. The #CORPSAct will allow hundreds of thousands of volunteers to be activated to meet the full range of local needs in our communities.

Over 6.3 mil Americans have tested positive for #COVID19.

The #HeroesAct provides $75 billion to ramp up testing efforts so we can rapidly identify & isolate #COVID19 cases. This can help stop community spread & repair our economy.

We need a robust COVID-19 relief package now.

I'm proud to announce that @CDCgov will award @NCDHHS $2.2mil for firearm injury research.

The American people have suffered from deadly gun violence for too long. It is past time we treat this as the public health crisis that it is.

My full statement: https://t.co/WWZkY65ZXU

I enjoyed my conversation this week with @NCHCOnline about all things housing, including the challenges of the ongoing pandemic and how to build a more equitable housing future in NC and nationwide.

Listen here: https://t.co/GIwqfB9qgb

Here are some FAQs from @NLIHC about the new moratorium: https://t.co/BVfapAPGC1
Congratulations Dr. Cohen! All of us in North Carolina are grateful for your leadership and dedication to public health. https://t.co/i4PqqZXDtX

The #COVID19 pandemic is not confined to borders & .@realdonaldtrump ‘s “go-it-alone” approach to the pandemic has led to disastrous results.

Pulling funding from @WHO threatens decades of work to combat diseases around the world and risks our economic and national security. https://t.co/0STjkWwZcH

Many North Carolinians have been taking public health precautions to heart, but we’re not out of the woods yet.

175,000+ Americans have died from #COVID19.

Millions lost jobs.

It's not over.

Instead of responding to COVID19 and negotiating an aid package, @realdonaldtrump is misusing taxpayer dollars to run his political convention FROM THE WHITE HOUSE.

It stinks to the high heavens.

Every community requires locally-led solutions to combat #COVID19.

I authored legislation that will expand @AmeriCorps to ensure community programs that are helping those in need have the workforce necessary to confront this crisis.
#Stand4Service

https://t.co/V82zpNojVE https://t.co/hQqQAkT3mE

Since then:
-80,000+ more Americans died from COVID
-Millions became unemployed
-Federal unemployment benefits expired
-Eviction & foreclosure protections lapsed

Now @realDonaldTrump is trying to weaken it after his administration failed to contain #COVID19. We must recommit to protecting this program for those who depend on it. #SocSec85

Happy to celebrate National Health Center Week! NC is home to incredible CHCs that provide quality, affordable health care to an estimated 600K North Carolinians each year. Support for CHCs is key to fighting #COVID19 & keeping America healthy. #NHCW20

Despite providing essential public services during #COVID19 and every day, Black women make on average $23k less per year or nearly $1 mil less over a 40-yr career compared to white men. It is long past time to pay Black women the wages they deserve. #BlackWomensEqualPay #wagegap

SUCCESS: The House just passed my @appropsdems "T-HUD" funding bill.

This bill makes needed investments in affordable housing & multimodal transportation while keeping people safe by requiring masks on planes, trains, and transit.
 
Next step: negotiations with the Senate.

BREAKING: @realdonaldtrump is threatening to VETO my transportation & housing funding bill because of my amendment requiring everyone to wear masks on planes, trains, and buses.

His flagrant disregard for basic public health measures puts us all in danger. https://t.co/K6vhxC2WsW

GOP says they want to get Americans back to work, but their plan to cut unemployment benefits could eliminate 1+ mil jobs compared to @HouseDemocrats bill to keep $600/wk benefits, according to @economics_ma.

Cutting unemployment benefits during a pandemic is cruel & bad policy.

For 55 years, Medicare and Medicaid have provided health care and financial security to millions of Americans. 

As #COVID19 exacerbates existing health inequities, we must expand, not cut, these vital programs ensuring affordable health care. https://t.co/zlrxeXigpi

Today's economic report confirms what we already knew -@realdonaldtrump's refusal to take COVID-19 seriously is costing lives and livelihoods.

@HouseDemocrats have. We passed the #HeroesAct TEN WEEKS ago to combat the public health AND economic crisis. We must act! https://t.co/IRYZTmaTFu

.@realDonaldTrump’s harmful rule giving employers the right to decide if employees can get #birthcontrol coverage is unacceptable.

I’m proud to support @RepLoisFrankel & @RepBarbaraLee’s @AppropsDems LHHS amendment to undo this & keep health decisions between patients & doctors.

State & local governments are struggling. #COVID19 could cause cuts to roughly 1.5mil jobs & decimate vital services.

I asked and 4000+ constituents answered with overwhelmingly support for extending federal pandemic unemployment benefits.

@SenateMajldr what are you waiting for? Pass the #HeroesAct now. https://t.co/Vf42oHDvIH

No one should have to risk their health to exercise their right to vote.

Senate Republicans must act now—our democracy depends on it.

Working families need reliable, safe child care options, but #COVID19 is shuttering hundreds of facilities nationwide.

I'm supporting two bills this week to ensure child care centers can operate safely and to help families with their expenses. https://t.co/3stPsw0HmJ

The Republican COVID-19 package is a nonstarter. Instead of protecting workers, it shields wrongdoers from accountability. Rather than supporting needs like food, rental, & health assistance, it strips federal unemployment benefits.

We need REAL relief to heal. https://t.co/dlBOnDLDzk
RT @WakeGOV: Need a FREE #COVID19 test? We have spots available this week in the parking deck of the Sunnybook Building, 2925 Holston Lane,…

https://t.co/vbKdseAYdF

#COVID19 is far from over. @USMayors know we need locally-led solutions & @Americorps has the infrastructure ready. That’s why @chrisCoons & I are fighting for an increase to national service in the next COVID relief package. #Stand4Service

From increased investments in gender-specific health care for female veterans to resources for safe military family housing, I'm proud to support the FY21 MilCon-VA @AppropsDems funding bill.

Those who have lost their livelihood in the middle of a pandemic deserve support. #ExtendUI https://t.co/IDIdbiJbiO

Expanding @AmeriCorps can help us recover from #COVID19 while providing young people the opportunity to serve their communities, earn an education award & living stipend, & gain important skills. #stand4service 

https://t.co/gx999mGoXZ

What are we waiting for?

Let’s expand @AmeriCorps to respond to #COVID19 #Stand4Service

https://t.co/sraTJ4ADnb

Now, the Admin has ordered CDC to stop collecting hospital data.

We know what they're hiding: Trump's failure to contain the pandemic.

For decades, NEPA required federal agencies to review the long-term environmental impacts of projects on health and safety. Now, President Trump is gutting NEPA & giving more power to polluters, which ultimately puts the most vulnerable communities at risk. #PeopleoverPolluters

COVID-19 is causing an eviction crisis, but we have the tools to avoid it:

- Extend the eviction moratorium
- Provide rental assistance
- Renew unemployment benefits for those who lost their livelihoods   

We can't afford to wait. https://t.co/zhzH1ULcC9

More than 30 million Americans are receiving emergency unemployment relief through the CARES Act.

@Senatemajldr wants those benefits to expire in less than 2 weeks. That’s unconscionable. The #COVID19 pandemic is far from over and we must #PassTheHeroesAct NOW.

FCI Butner has experienced one of the worst #COVID19 outbreaks, resulting in the deaths of 25 incarcerated individuals & 1 staff member-- more than any federal prison.

This week, I championed an @appropsDems provision to hold @OfficialFBOP accountable.

https://t.co/obXFhHuFtq

Patients and providers shouldn’t have to risk their health or the health of those around them when telehealth services are available. I signed a letter urging the FDA to address this issue & this ruling is a win, but we must continue pushing to rescind this rule permanently.

Blocking the FDA’s medically unnecessary “in-person requirement” for medication abortion during the pandemic is an important first step in ensuring the health and wellbeing of those seeking this essential healthcare service. https://t.co/gQ8x43wIBi

Across the country & in NC, we have seen the dire need to strengthen our election infrastructure & security. Especially during the pandemic, voting should be accessible, transparent, & secure. 

@AppropsDems FY21 FSGG bill includes $500M for Election Security Grants.

Access to affordable housing is a crisis & is being worsened by the impacts of #COVID19.

My @AppropsDems T-HUD bill fully funds Sec 8 Vouchers plus add'l vouchers for at-risk people & incl. 23% increase for homeless assistance grants to protect the most vulnerable.

PASSED: We know masks work. Since the @realDonaldTrump administration won’t act, Congress must.

That’s why I introduced an amendment to @AppropsDems requiring masks for all employees and passengers on planes, trains, and transit during COVID19. #WearAMask https://t.co/vvoYnihXAR

- 900+ cases
- 25 incarcerated individuals & 1 staff member have died

I’m happy to advocate for programs such as @NCMEP, an especially important resource that develops partnerships for #SmallBiz to meet pandemic PPE needs & prevent layoffs during the #COVID19 pandemic. @AppropsDems bill increases the MEP program by $7M.

As the nation calls for justice & we combat #COVID19, we must realize the great value of #SocialSciences.

The FY21 @AppropsDems CJS bill includes language that affirms the importance of @NSF social science research in areas such as public health & education.

BREAKING: DHS rescinded its misguided policy that aimed to bar international students from safely attending US schools fully online this fall due to COVID-19. This is a win for students & US higher ed institutions.
RT @NC_Governor: At 3 PM, Gov. Cooper will be giving an update on COVID-19 and K-12 public schools. Watch live here: https://t.co/rwEz4lEZNG
RT @NC_Governor: Gov. Cooper will be sharing an update on COVID-19 and making an announcement on the plan for K-12 public schools this fall…

The FY21 @AppropsDems DOD bill reverses proposed cuts to the Cooperative Threat Reduction program and provides $360 million to help partner nations address a wide range of chemical, nuclear and biological threats, including pandemics like #COVID19.

Experts have been telling us for years: gun violence is a public health crisis.

Earlier this year, I led a letter with 146 colleagues to address this. I am pleased that @appropsDems Labor-HHS-Ed FY21 bill will include $50M for the @NIH & @CDC to conduct gun violence research.

#COVID19 is worsening throughout the country.

The FY21 Labor-HHS-Ed @AppropsDems funding bill provides $24.5bil to rebuild aged public health infrastructure while also supporting state & local public health departments, public health laboratories, & global health activities.

Too many communities face barriers and suffer from broken infrastructure.

The @AppropsDems FY21 Energy & Water funding bill provides $43.5 billion in emergency funding to modernize water & energy infrastructure needed to keep our communities healthy.

Today @AppropsDems will mark up the Energy & Water and Labor-HHS-Ed funding bills. These FY21 bills will fund climate change resiliency, pandemic preparedness, workforce training, & our nation's schools.

Tune in to the livestream at 1PM: https://t.co/V4c8BVREqk

.@HouseDemocrats passed the #HEROESAct in May to extend unemployment benefits, ensure free #COVID19 treatment, & provide rental support.

But @senatemajldr thinks families can wait. Delaying needed relief puts Americans at risk. It’s time to pass the Heroes Act NOW.

We’re in the middle of an unprecedented health crisis. Yet, Republicans are trying to scapegoat and withhold funding from the @WHO. 

It’s completely inappropriate. I & @AppropsDems opposed their amendment & will continue to advocate for scientifically sound policies. https://t.co/hpRGQrFMn0

I’m pleased that Durham’s UDI Community Development Cooperation will receive 550k in CARES Act funding to help local small businesses respond to the pandemic. 

Our small businesses are a key component of the economic recovery.

PASSED✅: My amendment blocking the so-called EPA "transparency" rule just passed in the Appropriations Committee.
 
It will stop funding this anti-science rule and allow scientists at the EPA to freely pursue and use sound research to protect public health.

The @AppropsDems Military Construction & VA FY21 funding bill provides $661 mil for gender-specific services for women, the fastest growing population of veterans. 

All veterans deserve access to equitable, timely, and appropriate health care.

Healthy, affordable food shouldn’t be a luxury. 

That’s why I’m proud to support @AppropsDems’ FY21 Agriculture-Rural Development-FDA bill to protect SNAP against the administration’s attempts to limit program eligibility.

While Trump wants “America alone”, the truth is, we need allies to combat crises like climate change & COVID-19.

The @AppropsDems FY21 State-Foreign Ops bill rejects Trump's go-it-alone approach & instead reaffirms strong support for development & diplomacy.

Withdrawing from the @WHO during a global pandemic is deadly & dangerous to the health of people across the globe. We must fix this.

- Provide free testing
- Expand food assistance & unemployment insurance
